newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico supermarket store sales fall - INEGI.
newsitem.headline: Mexico supermarket store sales fall - INEGI.

text.p: Supermarket store sales during the first two months of the year in Mexico fell 1.1 percent compared with the year-ago period, the National Statistics Institute (INEGI) said on Thursday.
INEGI said its survey of 30 urban areas showed sales fell 1.6 percent in January and 0.5 percent in February.
INEGI's survey is broader than a similar survey by the National Association of Supermarket and Department Stores (ANTAD).
ANTAD reported last month that supermarket sales had fallen two percent during the year's first two months compared with the same period of 1996.
((Tomas de la Rosa, Mexico City newsroom +525 728-9565))
